Case reference: 2020007968.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1977, Aurelio Ferreira was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Aurelio was despondent.

Case reference: 2014004628.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2005, Patrick Marshall was last seen when he left his residence in the North East area of Jean Cote, Alberta. Patrick had left a note indicating that he would be travelling to Calgary with a friend. The note also indicated that he would be in contact within a few weeks. When he left, Patrick left with minimal clothes and toiletries.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark brown, turning grey

Case reference: 2014002919.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1988, Andrée Thibault was seen for the last time the Sainte-Marie District in Montreal, Quebec. Andrée may have been seen in Western Canada in the Vancouver, British-Columbia area.

Case reference: 2014005786.CaseDesc: Giuseppe Renda was last seen on May 4, 2012, at approximately 12:30 p.m., on Saint-Viateur Street West in the Plateau Mont-Royal borough of Montreal, Quebec. Giuseppe lived in the Westmount District, and was a discreet man who did not leave his home often.

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2019076552.CaseDesc: On January 9, 2019, Beau St. Cyr was reported missing by his family.  He was last known to be living in the United States where he holds dual citizenship. Beau was last seen in Canada in 2011 in Atlin, British Columbia. Beau stated that he intended to live off the grid in New York State, USA, but his family has not heard from him since 2015.

Case reference: 2013000124.CaseDesc: Maxwell Brown is from Bella Bella and traveled to Klemtu to look for work in late April 2012.  He was last seen in Klemtu on May 1, 2012.

Hat: Black, BASEBALL, Baseball cap with "C" on front
Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, "REST IN PEACE"

Case reference: 2014005145.CaseDesc: Sometime after July 30, 1939, Charles "Henry" Baxter went missing from the Hawarden District, SK. At the time of his disappearance, it was thought that Mr. Baxter went across the river to Tichfield to find work, or even joined the military and went overseas. However, Mr. Baxter was never seen again by his family, and these theories have never been substantiated.

Case reference: 2017027475.CaseDesc: On May 14, 2017, Roman Mussabekov was seen for the last time when he boarded a flight at the Montreal-Pierre-Elliott-Trudeau International Airport in Montreal, Quebec. He checked-in at a hotel on the island of Antigua in the Caribbean, but did not check-out. Roman contacted his mother a few days after his arrival to tell her that he was going on a hike in the mountains. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Short, Straight, Short on the sides, longer on top

Case reference: 2017001353.CaseDesc: On December 30, 2016 at 2:00 a.m., Derek Ritz was last seen on foot in Sebringville, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006011199.CaseDesc: On May 9, 1986, Gregory Beaumont left the Silver Lake Campground by boat to fish on the lake. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005378.CaseDesc: On September 8, 2004, Robert Harrington was last seen near the intersection of Oakwood Avenue and Vaughan Road in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002267.CaseDesc: On April 11, 1992, Pawel Gazdzicki was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Pawel was despondent, suffered from mental health issues, and may have lost his memory. He had mentioned wanting to jump off of the Champlain Bridge.

Case reference: 2016061373.CaseDesc: On March 30, 1980, an unidentified male was discovered floating in Lake Ontario at the rear of 2115 Lakeshore Blvd West. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 146lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he had moderate osteoarthritis of spine.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2014005776.CaseDesc: James Turgeon was last seen on Wednesday, April 17, 2012 at approximately 3:00 p.m. traveling East on foot on Highway #16 near North Battleford, SK. Mr. Turgeon has known mental health issues and has been diagnosed with schizophrenia. He has a history of walking away from his residence, but will usually return. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2017045266.CaseDesc: On August 7, 2017, James Candy was reported missing from his residence north of Lavoy, Alberta. James was last seen in his bedroom the night before on August 6, 2017 at approximately 11:00 pm.

Case reference: 2016055037.CaseDesc: Human remains were found on May 10, 2006 in a field near Mossleigh, AB. They are believed to be those of a female, over the age of 40, possibly of Caucasian or Aboriginal descent, who was between 5’2” and 5’6”. The individual was missing teeth and likely wore an upper denture. The individual may have complained of joint pain due to arthritis. The remains appear to have been there from 1 to 5 years

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Cheek, Healed fracture of right cheek bone
Mark: Right Side Of Head, Large button osteoma on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2015017945.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1995, fishermen saw a man's body in the waters of the Prairie River near Gagné Island. According to experts the approximate time of death would be from a few days to a week.

Shoes: Black, only one shoe found; size 10EEE

Case reference: 2014001154.CaseDesc: On May 1st, 1974, the remains of an adult male were found near the East Saanich Reserve in British Columbia. He was approximately 60-75 years old, wore dentures and it is believed that he would have gone missing more than ten years before. A silver Eversharp pencil from the 1920’s engraved with the initials “MC” was found near the body.

Boots: Leather, Black, Ankle boot, size 8 or 9

Case reference: 2014001237.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of a well nourished man were found floating in Lost Lagoon in Stanley Park that is located in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had his natural teeth and had taken his own life.

Case reference: 2012020651.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1984, Patricia Favel was seen for the last time in the downtown area of Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2006002699.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1996, a male was found in a field 50m north of Lakeshore Boulevard and 200m west of Spadina Avenue in Toronto. His post-mortem length was measured to be 5'8"-5'9" however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. Staining of his teeth suggests that he may have been a smoker. He is estimated to have died a few weeks to months prior to his discovery.

Hair: Grey, White, Ponytail, ponytail 12" long with receding hairline
Teeth: His teeth have both amalgam fillings and many untreated cavities

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2020036483.CaseDesc: Dorothy Cox was seen for the last time between the months of December 1942 and April 1943 in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003140.CaseDesc: Anthony Philip Porter was last seen on June 26, 1969 while he was picking up groceries near his home in the city of Kimberley, British Columbia. He never returned. Anthony is developmentally delayed.

Scar: Right Calf, Two inch scar on right shin
Head, Half inch scar over the right ear

Case reference: 2014003835.CaseDesc: Janice Howe left her family home in the Fort Garry area driving her father's 1985 Oldsmobile Cierra, and has not been seen since. Ms. Howe's vehicle was located the following morning 19 km east of Kenora, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002034.CaseDesc: In 1968, Christina Littlejohn was last seen on the Roseau River First Nation reserve in Manitoba. Further investigations by the RCMP revealed that Christina had been murdered by her common law partner. In 2002, the RCMP’s Cold Case Unit laid murder charges against her common law partner, however he passed away before the trial commenced. To date Christina’s remains have not been located.

Teeth: Other, She is missing a tooth on the lower right jaw

Case reference: 2014004992.CaseDesc: On October 12, 2004, at approximately 11:30 a.m., Kim Evans was seen for the last time at the North York Women’s Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Kim had said she was going to her family’s residence to collect her personal belongings.

Pierce: Nose, Nose ring on the right side

Case reference: 2006022999.CaseDesc: Spike Jorgenson was last seen crossing Chief Bay, Lake Nipigon in a canoe on September 28, 1973. It is believed that his canoe capsized, and he is presumed drowned.

Amputation: Right Index Finger, at the second joint

Case reference: 2014002300.CaseDesc: Steven Thomas MacLaren was reported missing when he failed to show up at work on July  11, 1981.  When last spoken to, he had planned on going hiking in Kananaskis Provincial Park. It is believed he was last seen on June 29, 1981.

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Other, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2014005998.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2013, Joshua Miller was seen for the last time in the downtown area of St. John’s Newfoundland.

Shirt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Purple shirt with black stripes

Case reference: 2014002244.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2000, Giuseppe Ciancio was seen for the last time at the Beaches Pub in the Saint-Laurent District of Montreal, Quebec. On that evening, Giuseppe left the bar with a friend in a beige Dodge Caravan. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002821.CaseDesc: During the weekend of August 18, 1972, Dennis Simpson and a friend left for a fishing trip on McMillian Lake. When they failed to return by the 22nd, numerous people contacted police. Through investigation it was later determined that both men were last seen by a man on shore on Sunday the 20th, and their camp was still set up. They told the individual that they were going to make one more pass and then intended to break camp. Weather conditions at the time were such that there would have been rough water. Given this and the fact that the men were in a fairly small canoe, it was determined they may have capsized. An extensive land, water and air search did not find anything other than various articles that were identified as belonging to the two missing fishermen. Mr. Simpson has never been located.

Case reference: 2014003060.CaseDesc: Pierre Lagacé was last seen on January 5, 2003. At the time, he was living in the Ville Lemoyne sector of Longueuil, Québec. Mr. Lagacé was reported missing by a family member. At the time of his disappearance, he had little money and no car in his name.

Case reference: 2014004993.CaseDesc: On the 5th of July, 2002, Percy McKenzie was last seen near Powell Island on Lac La Ronge lake, La Ronge, Saskatchewan. Mr. McKenzie was alone and the lake was very rough at the time. Searches failed to locate Percy McKenzie.

Case reference: 2014003402.CaseDesc: Joan Currie was last seen around February 20, 1981. It is believed that she was traveling to Prince Edward Island to visit her parents. She suffers from alcoholism.

Case reference: 2015015784.CaseDesc: Richele Bear was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on September 5, 2013. She was last seen on August 9, 2013 leaving a residence in the 900 block of Rae Street. She is believed to live a high risk lifestyle.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, A round inoculation scar (10mm)

Case reference: 2014003281.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1971, at around 6:30 am, Eileen “Gail” McCarthy was last seen leaving her home in Edmonton, Alberta to go to work at the Misericordia Hospital. Eileen worked as a nurse and did not arrive at work that day. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Brown, White, Brown Coat with White Fur Collar

Case reference: 2021045206.CaseDesc: On September 3, 2021, Mark Dolan was last seen by his family when he was dropped off at a bus terminal in Brantford, Ontario. His last banking transaction was captured on video at 294 Louisa Street in Parry Sound, Ontario, on October 28, 2021.

Luggage: Other, Multi coloured hiking style backpack.

Case reference: 2012020142.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2008, Shannon Alexander, 17 and Maisy Odjick, 16, were reported missing from the First Nation community of Kitigan Zibi in Quebec. This community is located near the town of Maniwaki. On September 5, 2008, the two girls went to the Maniwaki arena, where several young people were present. Maisy then went to spend the night at Shannon’s house. Shannon’s father was the last person to have seen his daughter on September 6, 2008. In 2015 an age progression was done for both Maisy and Shannon.

Pierce: Mouth, 2 loops on the lower lip

Case reference: 2014006338.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1988, George Burke was last seen by his wife, when he left their residence in Edmonton, Alberta, to take the bus to work. That day, George did not arrive at work, and it is unknown whether he caught the bus.

Case reference: 2006004499.CaseDesc: James Pearce was last seen in the Grafton area on October 5, 1999. On October 8, 1999, his 1949 pink Dodge pick-up truck was located at the Cobourg train station parking lot.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Brush Cut, Recent #2 cut at time of disappearance
Tattoo: Right Hand, Banner with the name Laurie
Left Arm, Skeleton with top hat
Scar: Torso (Back), Numerous scars from an accident
Head, A 1 inch scar under hair on left side
Left Leg, Scar from a fracture

Case reference: 2014002360.CaseDesc: On August 25, 1996, Benoit Lachance was seen for the last time in the Pointes-Aux-Trembles District in Montreal, Quebec. Benoit was a member of a motorcycle club called the "Rowdy Crew" and drove a blue Chevrolet Camaro.

Scar: Middle Back, Bullet still in the back

Case reference: 1999000026.CaseDesc: On Oct 15, 1997, Jami Furnandiz was last seen in the town of Port Perry, Ontario, after dropping her child off to day care.  She was scheduled to attend school in the area but did not show up and has not been seen since.  Jami Furnandiz frequented the Oshawa downtown and was known to hitchhike by means of traveling between cities.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, red heart with arrow through it

Case reference: 2020024219.CaseDesc: On the night of July 6, 2020, Richard Kocik left his residence in Wasaga Beach, Ontario on foot. Richard left his wallet and personal identification behind. Richard has a history of walking away from his residence due to mental health issues similar to dementia. He has always been located after a few days. There was an extensive search conducted to locate Richard which yielded negative results.

Hair: Black, Grey, Salt and pepper hair colour
Tattoo: Left Chest, Heart shaped thumb print
Left Forearm, Footprint with the name "Ryan"

Case reference: 2017061069.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1976, John Winer was seen for the last time as he sat on a railing near the falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Some of John’s personal belongings were found near the railing.

Case reference: 2014003811.CaseDesc: On December 28, 1988, Murray Copp was seen for the last time at the Salvation Army Community and Family Services Centre in Moncton, New Brunswick.

Scar: Nose, Between eyes and above nose

Case reference: 2018067156.CaseDesc: On November 27, 2018, Courtney James was seen for the last time on security camera footage in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006009799.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1974, Francis Foster, Robert Warren and another friend departed for a canoe trip on Basswood Lake, Quetico Park, 45 miles (72 km) south of Atikokan, Ontario. It is believed that the canoe overturned and all three are presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014025774.CaseDesc: In August 2014, Pawel Przybyla was reported missing by his family. He was last believed to be in the Edmonton, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2014005292.CaseDesc: On December 4, 1992, at approximately 6:30am, Renata Ejsmont was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The day before her disappearance, Renata had quit her job and told her former employer that she was moving back to Poland.

Case reference: 2018063238.CaseDesc: On January 20, 2001, Edward Pinarreto was seen for the last time when he left Toronto, Ontario, for a two-week vacation in Cuba. Edward was scheduled to return to Toronto on February 3, but never board his flight.

Case reference: 2013000017.CaseDesc: In August 1983, Jannisina "Jan" Stonehouse left her home in Oakville and has not been seen since. She may have left home due to being pregnant.  Jannisina may have been in the company of Darlene Tucker who is also missing. Refer to case 1993001330

Teeth: Good, Four teeth treated (one tooth had partial nerve treatment), one tooth absent lower left jaw. Dental chart on file.

Case reference: 2020028767.CaseDesc: In the late evening of August 24, 1975, Jean-Marc Meagher was seen for the last time in Berthierville, Quebec.

Case reference: 2020010478.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1970, at approximately 3:30pm, Lois Perret was last seen by her boyfriend at her place of work in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Lois had quit her job and moved out of her apartment. During the time of her disappearance, Lois was three months pregnant and drove a 1964 black Valiant convertible.

Case reference: 2014004377.CaseDesc: On October 3, 2003, a family member contacted Police and reported that ROSS had been missing since the evening of October 1st. She indicated ROSS and his cousin were drinking together that night and that on their way home his cousin lost sight of ROSS in the bushes. ROSS did not return home. Numerous sightings were reported to police in the days following ROSS' disappearance however no one spoke directly to ROSS. As a result these sightings are unconfirmed. Further unconfirmed sightings were reported across Canada as well and were investigated. ROSS has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2014005757.CaseDesc: Harley Boxall was seen leaving his residence in Nanaimo on March 9, 2012. A suicide note was located in his room suggesting he was going to drown himself. However, within weeks of being reported missing, there were unconfirmed reports of Mr. Boxall within the city of Nanaimo or that he may be residing with the homeless community in Vancouver’s lower-Eastside.

Case reference: 2014002118.CaseDesc: Henry M’Lot was reported missing by his brother on November 13, 1973. At the time of his disappearance, he was despondent due to the separation with his wife.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Head, Burr hole from operation right front side of skull

Case reference: 2019017116.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2003, Anne-Marie Laforest was last seen by her family in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018063038.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1998, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Beverley Cole was last seen leaving her group home in Toronto, Ontario. Beverley had left with all of her personal belongings.

Case reference: 2016060096.CaseDesc: Conrad Roderick Jason Ducharme was reported missing on October 25, 2016, by family members who had not heard from or seen him in two months. Conrad was last known by family to be hitch hiking to a meeting in Dixonville, Alberta in July 2016. He was last seen in Manning, Alberta, in early September 2016.

Case reference: 2008004299.CaseDesc: Ghazaros Allahverdioglu was boating with family on Fairy Lake in the town of Huntsville, Ontario.  He apparently fell off the boat by One Tree Island in Fairy Lake.

Case reference: 2016012267.CaseDesc: On February 28, 2016, Lorlene Bone was last seen at a friend’s residence on the Shoal River Indian Reserve in Manitoba. Lorlene is a mother of four and it is out of character for her not to contact her family.

Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, Three hearts

Case reference: 2021044031.CaseDesc: David-Alexandre Beliveau was reported missing on September 27, 2021 and was last known to be in Calgary, Alberta on September 4, 2021. David has a number of unique tattoos on his hands, arm and back.

Case reference: 2017061282.CaseDesc: On March 23, 1999, Andrew Fraser was seen for the last time near the falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000127.CaseDesc: Howard Graveline dissappeared from his home on décembre 29, 2011.  His car, passport and wallet were left behind.

Case reference: 2017076317.CaseDesc: Dakota Anzovino was last seen on December 23, 2017, in the City of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Boots: Tan, Black, Winter, Brand: "Sorel"; with white fur
Jeans: Denim, Grey, Light Blue, Or grey in colour
Jacket: Black, Grey, Plaid with dark hood

Case reference: 2005004499.CaseDesc: On August 31, 1996, the body of an unidentified woman was recovered from the Niagara River near the Maid of the Mist dock. Her appendix is present and she may have stretch marks on her thighs.

Teeth: She has natural teeth with one restoration in her left lower second molar.
Underwear: Plaid, Fruit of the Loom, multi-coloured, plaid panties with a white waistband, size 5
Jeans: Denim, Blue, "Hunt Club" jeans, manufactured by Sears, size 14

Case reference: 2014002921.CaseDesc: Alban Robichaud has been missing since May 30, 1991. Alban was employed with City Laundry and left this day at 3pm. Alban was seen in various uptown Saint John pubs and was last seen at Gene's Country Palace between 11:00 & 11:30 pm.

Case reference: 2006026899.CaseDesc: Dr. Kemp left his residence in Sturgeon Falls, on May 19, 1960, to go fishing. On May 20, 1960, he failed to return home and was reported missing. On May 21, 1960, his vehicle was found parked at Finlayson Lake, McLaren Township, District of Nipissing. His canoe and personal belongings were located on the lake.

Case reference: 2014005286.CaseDesc: Karl Behr was last seen on December 25, 1981, in Edmonton, Alberta, when he left a family function to return to his residence. It was noted that Karl's green parka and winter boots were missing from his home. Karl speaks with a slight German accent.

Case reference: 2014004887.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2005, Ghassem Sabeiri Gilchalan was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003167.CaseDesc: Rufus Standingribbon was last seen in the month of October 1999 near Spirit River, Alberta. Mrs. Standingribbon did not notify anyone that he was going to be leaving the area as he normally did.

Case reference: 2014004602.CaseDesc: Denis Gelinas left his home in Notre-Dame-Du-Mont-Carmel on the morning of December 31, 1993 and was never seen again.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Snake and a dagger

Case reference: 2009247848.CaseDesc: Christopher and Alexander are missing from the York region but were located in Poland where they are residing with their non-custodial mother.

Case reference: 2021030286.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2021 Mona Hu was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Mona had been in contact with her family in China, and was arranging to travel to see them.

Case reference: 2022016834.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2022, Shawn Mines was seen for the last time doing renovations in a residence in Portage La Praire, Manitoba. A week prior to his disappearance, Shawn’s mother passed away, and he was despondent.

Case reference: 2017040839.CaseDesc: Claude Lévesque was last seen on July 17, 2017, in the Mercier/Hochelaga-Maisonneuve sector of Montreal. He had an appointment with his Doctor that afternoon, yet he never showed up. He is known to be despondent.

Scar: Right Forearm, Front of arm, wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2014001617.CaseDesc: On January 25, 1976, Camille Lessard was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. He regularly went to the tavern located on the corner of Papineau  and Sainte-Catherine East in the Le Village district of Montreal, Quebec. Camille suffers from memory loss.

Case reference: 2012020095.CaseDesc: On February 21, 2006, between 8:00 and 8:30 am Draper Jim was dropped off on the road by the Health Center on the Saulteaux First Nation (North of Cochin, Saskatchewan). Draper was attempting to return home to the Witchekan First Nation and has not been seen since.

Scar: Lower Lip, Left side of lower lip
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Ying Yang Symbol

Case reference: 2008021099.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1966, Diane Prevost was seen for the last time as she was camping at Grundy Provincial Park in Britt, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Diane had been playing on the beach, and had told her father that she wanted to go back to the campsite. When her father turned to do so, she was gone.

Shirt: Blue, Red, checked top with red at cuffs and collar

Case reference: 2006011399.CaseDesc: Raymond Juranitch went hunting and fishing on the Ogoki Reservoir 80 km northeast of Armstrong, Ontario. He was last seen alone in a 16' aluminum canoe, powered by a 9.8 HP outboard motor. An extensive search of the area failed to locate Mr. Juranitch.

Case reference: 2016061955.CaseDesc: On July 28, 1975, the body of a Caucasian male was found wedged in between a wooden fence and a pillar on King Street East, in Toronto. His appendix is present. An autopsy determined that this man was an alcoholic.

Teeth: Stained, His teeth were in poor condition with no dental work present and stains indicate that he was a smoker.
Other: Knife with a white handle 4" long
Watch: Timex watch, black dial with a date indicator. There is a red cross in middle of the dial.

Case reference: 2014005318.CaseDesc: In November of 1983, Tony Spalancin was seen for the last time leaving his place of employment in Drayton Valley, Alberta. It is believed that Tony travelled to Calgary, Alberta, to seek new employment. His vehicle was later located in Calgary.

Case reference: 2020006647.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1980, Ophlin Facey was seen for the last time as she left the residence of her employer. During the time of her disappearance, Ophlin was a live-in house keeper, and it is possible she may have been heading to a party that day.

Case reference: 2014004949.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1968, it was reported that George Knott had been missing since the previous day. He had been traveling by boat between St. Theresa and Garden Hill, Manitoba. George's boat and dog were located. All attempts to locate him failed and he remains missing.

Scar: Left Shin, 1 inch lateral scar across left shin - axe wound
Left Knee, 1.5 inch lateral scar across inside left knee - axe wound
Left Foot, 1.5 inch lateral scar across top left foot - axe wound
1 inch lateral scar inside of right or left foot - axe wound

Case reference: 2011001699.CaseDesc: Justin Rutter left home on October 8, 2009 and failed to return.  He is known to frequent Lower Town in Ottawa, Ontario however, has not been seen in that area since that day. Justin may have met with foul play.

Coat: Beige, with white pattern on it
Mark: Right Cheek, 3 moles/freckles in the shape of a triangle

Case reference: 2006013699.CaseDesc: Emile Morissette was last seen while on a fishing trip at Birch Lake in Timmins Township, Ontario on July 6, 1976.

Case reference: 2014004566.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1981, at approximately 5:00pm, Dennis Krioul was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Dennis’ wife states that he was in some business trouble and he had a warrant out for his arrest for fraud.

Case reference: 2014046601.CaseDesc: Jason Beaupit has not been in contact with his family since September 2014. Mr. Beaupit was last seen on October 19, 2014, at a shelter in downtown Edmonton. He is known to travel and camp throughout British Columbia and Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020016.CaseDesc: Rhody Lake disappeared on Sunday, November 27, 2005.  She was last seen going for a walk in Sechelt's Porpoise Bay Provincial Park located in Sechelt, B.C.

Hat: Red, Orange, Toque - might be beige

Case reference: 2008008498.CaseDesc: Helen Lipinski went to the Roman Court Bingo Hall with her daughter. She stepped out of the hall, leaving her purse behind. Mrs. Lipinski has a history of mental health issues. She previously mentioned wanting to visit her sister in Chihuahua, Mexico.

Jewelry: Gold, birthstone with 7 stones, 1 was missing

Case reference: 2014002848.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1981, Daniel McKenzie was seen for the last time. Daniel was reported missing after he was seen leaving a taxi, and running into the wilderness along the Quebec and Labrador border.

Case reference: 2020040389.CaseDesc: On December 15, 1947, Rosella DeLong was seen for the last time leaving her family home in Toronto, Ontario. Rosella intended on travelling to the USA to take a course and to buy equipment to start a weight loss clinic.

Case reference: 2020011692.CaseDesc: Joyce MacDougall was last heard from on March 13, 1986, at approximately 7:30pm. Joyce telephoned her mother to inform her that she was going out for a few drinks, but she never returned home. On March 14, Joyce interacted with the police in Niagara Falls and during the course of the interaction she was issued a ticket and was taken to a restaurant. She was last seen at the restaurant by a server and had left her purse in the restaurant.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the left side of the cheek

Case reference: 2018063007.CaseDesc: On November 18, 1998, Anne Smythe was seen for the last time by her daughter, in Toronto, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Anne was headed in the direction of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 1993001330.CaseDesc: Darlene was last seen at home.
